UI overhaul: event-based colors, compact layout, no emojis

- Timeline grid dots now colored by event type \(MS/WS/MD/WD/XD\)
- Added detailed hover tooltips showing match info
- Removed redundant ScheduleDiagnosticsBar
- Compact constraints panel with inline status/counts
- Removed all emojis from UI, replaced with colored dots
- Unified light theme across all schedule components

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash("c:\\Users\\avlis\\OneDrive\\Documentos\\vsCode\\schedulingalg\\src\\venv\\Scripts\\python.exe" -c "
import sys
sys.path.insert\(0, ''c:/Users/avlis/OneDrive/Documentos/vsCode/schedulingalg/src''\)

from scheduler_core import schedule, ScheduleRequest, ScheduleConfig, SolverOptions, Player, Match

# Test case: 2 players, 2 matches, 4 slots, 2 courts
# With court utilization penalty enabled, we should see idle court penalties

config = ScheduleConfig\(
    total_slots=4,
    court_count=2,
    interval_minutes=30,
    default_rest_slots=1,
    enable_court_utilization=True,
    court_utilization_penalty=50.0,
    late_finish_penalty=0.5,
\)

players = [
    Player\(id=''p1'', name=''Player 1'', rest_slots=1\),
    Player\(id=''p2'', name=''Player 2'', rest_slots=1\),
    Player\(id=''p3'', name=''Player 3'', rest_slots=1\),
    Player\(id=''p4'', name=''Player 4'', rest_slots=1\),
]

matches = [
    Match\(id=''m1'', event_code=''MS-1'', duration_slots=1, side_a=[''p1''], side_b=[''p2'']\),
    Match\(id=''m2'', event_code=''MS-2'', duration_slots=1, side_a=[''p3''], side_b=[''p4'']\),
]

request = ScheduleRequest\(
    config=config,
    players=players,
    matches=matches,
    solver_options=SolverOptions\(time_limit_seconds=5.0\),
\)

result = schedule\(request\)

print\(f''Status: {result.status}''\)
print\(f''Objective Score: {result.objective_score}''\)
print\(f''Runtime: {result.runtime_ms:.2f}ms''\)
print\(\)
print\(''Assignments:''\)
for a in result.assignments:
    print\(f''  {a.match_id}: slot={a.slot_id}, court={a.court_id}''\)
print\(\)
print\(''Soft Violations:'', len\(result.soft_violations\)\)
for v in result.soft_violations:
    print\(f''  {v.type}: {v.description} \(penalty: {v.penalty_incurred}\)''\)
print\(\)

# Manual calculation check:
# Total court-slots = 4 slots * 2 courts = 8
# Occupied court-slots = 2 matches * 1 slot = 2
# Idle court-slots = 8 - 2 = 6
# Court utilization penalty = 6 * 50 * 10 = 3000 \(scaled by 10\)

# Late finish penalty for match at slot 0: 0.5 * 10 * 0 = 0
# Late finish penalty for match at slot 0: 0.5 * 10 * 0 = 0 \(if both start at slot 0\)
# Or if one starts at slot 1: 0.5 * 10 * 1 = 5

print\(''Expected court utilization penalty \(6 idle slots * 50 * 10\): 3000''\)
print\(f''Actual objective \(may include late_finish\): {result.objective_score}''\)
")

Bash("c:\\Users\\avlis\\OneDrive\\Documentos\\vsCode\\schedulingalg\\src\\venv\\Scripts\\python.exe" -c "
import sys
sys.path.insert\(0, ''c:/Users/avlis/OneDrive/Documentos/vsCode/schedulingalg/src''\)

from scheduler_core import schedule, ScheduleRequest, ScheduleConfig, SolverOptions, Player, Match

# Test: Same player in 2 matches with soft rest constraint
# Player p1 plays in both matches - should require rest slots between

config = ScheduleConfig\(
    total_slots=4,
    court_count=2,
    interval_minutes=30,
    default_rest_slots=2,  # Require 2 rest slots
    soft_rest_enabled=True,  # Make rest a soft constraint
    rest_slack_penalty=10.0,
    enable_court_utilization=False,  # Disable to isolate rest penalty
    late_finish_penalty=0.0,  # Disable
\)

players = [
    Player\(id=''p1'', name=''Player 1'', rest_slots=2, rest_is_hard=False, rest_penalty=10.0\),
    Player\(id=''p2'', name=''Player 2'', rest_slots=1\),
    Player\(id=''p3'', name=''Player 3'', rest_slots=1\),
]

matches = [
    Match\(id=''m1'', event_code=''MS-1'', duration_slots=1, side_a=[''p1''], side_b=[''p2'']\),
    Match\(id=''m2'', event_code=''MS-2'', duration_slots=1, side_a=[''p1''], side_b=[''p3'']\),
]

request = ScheduleRequest\(
    config=config,
    players=players,
    matches=matches,
    solver_options=SolverOptions\(time_limit_seconds=5.0\),
\)

result = schedule\(request\)

print\(f''Status: {result.status}''\)
print\(f''Objective Score: {result.objective_score}''\)
print\(\)
print\(''Assignments:''\)
for a in result.assignments:
    print\(f''  {a.match_id}: slot={a.slot_id}, court={a.court_id}''\)
print\(\)
print\(''Soft Violations:'', len\(result.soft_violations\)\)
for v in result.soft_violations:
    print\(f''  {v.type}: {v.description} \(penalty: {v.penalty_incurred}\)''\)

# Analysis:
# With 4 slots: 0, 1, 2, 3
# Player p1 needs 2 slots rest between matches \(1 duration + 2 rest = 3 slots gap\)
# Best case: m1 at slot 0, m2 at slot 3 \(3 slot gap = meets requirement\)
# If gap is less, we get rest slack violations
")

Bash("c:\\Users\\avlis\\OneDrive\\Documentos\\vsCode\\schedulingalg\\src\\venv\\Scripts\\python.exe" -c "
import sys
sys.path.insert\(0, ''c:/Users/avlis/OneDrive/Documentos/vsCode/schedulingalg/src''\)

from scheduler_core import schedule, ScheduleRequest, ScheduleConfig, SolverOptions, Player, Match

# Force a rest violation by having only 2 slots available
# Player p1 needs 2 rest slots but only 2 total slots means unavoidable violation

config = ScheduleConfig\(
    total_slots=2,  # Only 2 slots, forcing violation
    court_count=2,
    interval_minutes=30,
    default_rest_slots=2,  # Require 2 rest slots
    soft_rest_enabled=True,  # Make rest a soft constraint
    rest_slack_penalty=10.0,
    enable_court_utilization=False,
    late_finish_penalty=0.0,
\)

players = [
    Player\(id=''p1'', name=''Player 1'', rest_slots=2, rest_is_hard=False, rest_penalty=10.0\),
    Player\(id=''p2'', name=''Player 2'', rest_slots=0\),
    Player\(id=''p3'', name=''Player 3'', rest_slots=0\),
]

matches = [
    Match\(id=''m1'', event_code=''MS-1'', duration_slots=1, side_a=[''p1''], side_b=[''p2'']\),
    Match\(id=''m2'', event_code=''MS-2'', duration_slots=1, side_a=[''p1''], side_b=[''p3'']\),
]

request = ScheduleRequest\(
    config=config,
    players=players,
    matches=matches,
    solver_options=SolverOptions\(time_limit_seconds=5.0\),
\)

result = schedule\(request\)

print\(f''Status: {result.status}''\)
print\(f''Objective Score: {result.objective_score}''\)
print\(\)
print\(''Assignments:''\)
for a in result.assignments:
    print\(f''  {a.match_id}: slot={a.slot_id}, court={a.court_id}''\)
print\(\)
print\(''Soft Violations:'', len\(result.soft_violations\)\)
for v in result.soft_violations:
    print\(f''  Type: {v.type}''\)
    print\(f''  Player: {v.player_id}''\)
    print\(f''  Description: {v.description}''\)
    print\(f''  Penalty: {v.penalty_incurred}''\)

# Analysis:
# Slots 0 and 1 available, player p1 in both matches
# Best case: m1 at slot 0, m2 at slot 1 \(gap = 0 slots between end of m1 and start of m2\)
# Required rest = 2 slots, actual = 0, slack = 2
# Penalty = 2 * 10 * 10 = 200 \(scaled by 10\)
print\(\)
print\(''Expected: rest slack of 2 slots, penalty = 2 * 10 * 10 = 200''\)
")

Bash("c:\\Users\\avlis\\OneDrive\\Documentos\\vsCode\\schedulingalg\\src\\venv\\Scripts\\python.exe" -c "
import sys
sys.path.insert\(0, ''c:/Users/avlis/OneDrive/Documentos/vsCode/schedulingalg/src''\)

from scheduler_core import schedule, ScheduleRequest, ScheduleConfig, SolverOptions, Player, Match

print\(''=''*60\)
print\(''TEST 1: Minimum spacing constraint \(games too close\)''\)
print\(''=''*60\)

# Test minimum spacing: Player has 3 matches in 4 slots
# With min_spacing=2, they should be spread out \(if possible\)

config = ScheduleConfig\(
    total_slots=6,
    court_count=3,
    interval_minutes=30,
    default_rest_slots=0,  # Disable rest constraint to isolate proximity test
    enable_game_proximity=True,
    min_game_spacing_slots=2,  # Minimum 2 slots between games
    max_game_spacing_slots=None,
    game_proximity_penalty=10.0,
    enable_court_utilization=False,
    late_finish_penalty=0.0,
\)

players = [
    Player\(id=''p1'', name=''Player A'', rest_slots=0, rest_is_hard=False\),
    Player\(id=''p2'', name=''Player B'', rest_slots=0\),
    Player\(id=''p3'', name=''Player C'', rest_slots=0\),
    Player\(id=''p4'', name=''Player D'', rest_slots=0\),
]

# Player p1 is in all 3 matches
matches = [
    Match\(id=''m1'', event_code=''MS-1'', duration_slots=1, side_a=[''p1''], side_b=[''p2'']\),
    Match\(id=''m2'', event_code=''MS-2'', duration_slots=1, side_a=[''p1''], side_b=[''p3'']\),
    Match\(id=''m3'', event_code=''MS-3'', duration_slots=1, side_a=[''p1''], side_b=[''p4'']\),
]

result = schedule\(ScheduleRequest\(config=config, players=players, matches=matches\)\)

print\(f''Status: {result.status}''\)
print\(f''Objective Score: {result.objective_score}''\)
print\(\)
print\(''Assignments for Player A \(p1\):''\)
for a in sorted\(result.assignments, key=lambda x: x.slot_id\):
    print\(f''  {a.match_id}: slot={a.slot_id}, court={a.court_id}''\)
print\(\)
print\(''Soft Violations:'', len\(result.soft_violations\)\)
for v in result.soft_violations:
    print\(f''  {v.type}: {v.description} \(penalty: {v.penalty_incurred}\)''\)

# With 6 slots and min_spacing=2, matches at slots 0, 3 would be optimal \(gap of 2\)
# Or 0, 2, 4 - each has a gap of 1 \(below minimum of 2\)
")

Bash("c:\\Users\\avlis\\OneDrive\\Documentos\\vsCode\\schedulingalg\\src\\venv\\Scripts\\python.exe" -c "
import sys
sys.path.insert\(0, ''c:/Users/avlis/OneDrive/Documentos/vsCode/schedulingalg/src''\)

from scheduler_core import schedule, ScheduleRequest, ScheduleConfig, SolverOptions, Player, Match

print\(''=''*60\)
print\(''TEST 2: Maximum spacing constraint \(games too far apart\)''\)
print\(''=''*60\)

# Test maximum spacing: Player has 2 matches, slots 0 and 10
# With max_spacing=3, there will be a violation

config = ScheduleConfig\(
    total_slots=10,
    court_count=2,
    interval_minutes=30,
    default_rest_slots=0,
    enable_game_proximity=True,
    min_game_spacing_slots=None,  # No minimum
    max_game_spacing_slots=3,     # Maximum 3 slots between games
    game_proximity_penalty=10.0,
    enable_court_utilization=False,
    late_finish_penalty=0.0,
\)

players = [
    Player\(id=''p1'', name=''Player A'', rest_slots=0, rest_is_hard=False\),
    Player\(id=''p2'', name=''Player B'', rest_slots=0\),
    Player\(id=''p3'', name=''Player C'', rest_slots=0\),
]

# Force p1''s matches to be far apart by using availability constraints
# p2 only available at slot 0, p3 only available at slot 9
players[1].availability = [\(0, 1\)]  # p2 only available slot 0
players[2].availability = [\(9, 10\)]  # p3 only available slot 9

matches = [
    Match\(id=''m1'', event_code=''MS-1'', duration_slots=1, side_a=[''p1''], side_b=[''p2'']\),
    Match\(id=''m2'', event_code=''MS-2'', duration_slots=1, side_a=[''p1''], side_b=[''p3'']\),
]

result = schedule\(ScheduleRequest\(config=config, players=players, matches=matches\)\)

print\(f''Status: {result.status}''\)
print\(f''Objective Score: {result.objective_score}''\)
print\(\)
print\(''Assignments:''\)
for a in sorted\(result.assignments, key=lambda x: x.slot_id\):
    print\(f''  {a.match_id}: slot={a.slot_id}, court={a.court_id}''\)
print\(\)
print\(''Soft Violations:'', len\(result.soft_violations\)\)
for v in result.soft_violations:
    print\(f''  {v.type}: {v.description} \(penalty: {v.penalty_incurred}\)''\)

# m1 must be at slot 0 \(p2 availability\)
# m2 must be at slot 9 \(p3 availability\)
# Gap = 9 - 1 = 8 slots \(exceeds max of 3\)
# Violation = 8 - 3 = 5 slots
# Penalty = 5 * 10 = 50, objective = 50 * 10 = 500
print\(\)
print\(''Expected: gap of 8 slots, max_spacing=3, violation=5, penalty=50, objective=500''\)
")

Bash("c:\\Users\\avlis\\OneDrive\\Documentos\\vsCode\\schedulingalg\\src\\venv\\Scripts\\python.exe" -c "
import sys
sys.path.insert\(0, ''c:/Users/avlis/OneDrive/Documentos/vsCode/schedulingalg/src''\)

from scheduler_core import schedule, ScheduleRequest, ScheduleConfig, SolverOptions, Player, Match

print\(''=''*60\)
print\(''TEST 3: Both min and max spacing constraints''\)
print\(''=''*60\)

# Player has 3 matches with both min=2 and max=4 spacing
# In 8 slots, optimal would be spacing of ~2-3 between each match

config = ScheduleConfig\(
    total_slots=8,
    court_count=3,
    interval_minutes=30,
    default_rest_slots=0,
    enable_game_proximity=True,
    min_game_spacing_slots=2,
    max_game_spacing_slots=4,
    game_proximity_penalty=10.0,
    enable_court_utilization=False,
    late_finish_penalty=0.0,
\)

players = [
    Player\(id=''p1'', name=''Player A'', rest_slots=0, rest_is_hard=False\),
    Player\(id=''p2'', name=''Player B'', rest_slots=0\),
    Player\(id=''p3'', name=''Player C'', rest_slots=0\),
    Player\(id=''p4'', name=''Player D'', rest_slots=0\),
]

matches = [
    Match\(id=''m1'', event_code=''MS-1'', duration_slots=1, side_a=[''p1''], side_b=[''p2'']\),
    Match\(id=''m2'', event_code=''MS-2'', duration_slots=1, side_a=[''p1''], side_b=[''p3'']\),
    Match\(id=''m3'', event_code=''MS-3'', duration_slots=1, side_a=[''p1''], side_b=[''p4'']\),
]

result = schedule\(ScheduleRequest\(config=config, players=players, matches=matches\)\)

print\(f''Status: {result.status}''\)
print\(f''Objective Score: {result.objective_score}''\)
print\(\)
print\(''Assignments \(sorted by slot\):''\)
for a in sorted\(result.assignments, key=lambda x: x.slot_id\):
    print\(f''  {a.match_id}: slot={a.slot_id}''\)
print\(\)
print\(''Soft Violations:'', len\(result.soft_violations\)\)
for v in result.soft_violations:
    print\(f''  {v.type}: {v.description} \(penalty: {v.penalty_incurred}\)''\)

# Ideal: m1 at slot 0, m2 at slot 3, m3 at slot 6
# Gaps: 0->3 = 2 \(ok\), 3->6 = 2 \(ok\)
print\(\)
print\(''Optimal would be slots 0, 3, 6 with gaps of 2 each \(within [2,4] range\)''\)
")
